title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 145-1.14 - Reawards
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 145-1.14 - Reawards

State Regulations
(a) An academic
performance award offered to an alternate after relinquishment of the award by
the original holder shall be subject to the same terms and conditions as
applied to the original holder. In particular, if the reaward is made after the
effective date of the award, the alternate shall be eligible to receive such
award only if he began approved study on the effective date of the award, or
would have been entitled to a leave of absence for such period. However, if the
alternate has, subsequent to the effective date, entered upon study in a school
or in a program not approved for the reaward, then the reaward shall be offered
instead to the next eligible alternate. (b) If a person who has declined an academic
performance award should rescind such declination during the period authorized
by law for reawards, such person shall be restored to the alternate list and
shall receive appropriate consideration for subsequent reawards that may become
available. No additional scholarship can be created for such purpose except in
the case of administrative error. Should such declination be rescinded after
the final date established for reawards, and should the declination have been
made originally through error or oversight on the part of the student, in the
judgment of the commissioner, then a reaward may be made if there is an
available scholarship in such scholarship series that has not yet been
accepted, provided that payment of scholarship benefits can begin only with the
academic year in which such reaward is made. (c) If the recipient of an academic
performance award has matriculated for the first semester following the
effective date of the award, but the award is subsequently relinquished or
revoked for reasons that make the recipient ineligible for any payment under
that award for such semester, then such award shall be available for reaward to
an alternate during the remaining period for reawards established by
law. Notes
